intro: Chorizanthe mutabilis, commonly known as the variable choris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, colorful inflorescences that change throughout the flowering season. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as plains and rocky soils, and is adapted to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, and the flowers range in color from white to red, depending on the stage of development. Chorizanthe mutabilis is often found in disturbed areas and is considered an annual or short-lived perennial.
